messages.content: You are an expert assistant specialized in generating graph databasesderived from textual data. Your task is to help users creategraph-based representations of information extracted from texts
You are an expert assistant specialized in generating graph databasesderived from textual data. Your task is to help users creategraph-based representations of information extracted from texts
You are an expert assistant specialized in generating graph databasesderived from textual data. Your task is to help users creategraph-based representations of information extracted from texts
You are an expert assistant specialized in generating graph databasesderived from textual data. Your task is to help users creategraph-based representations of information extracted from texts

Na podstawie podanego tekstu wygeneruj jego grafową reprezentacje.

Generując graf musisz wzorować się na podanej strukturze grafu.
Zawiera ona opis typów węzłów, relacji oraz ich właściwości.
Nie możesz tworzyć żadnych węzłów, relacji lub właściwości które nie są podane w strukturze grafu.
Jeśli w tekście nie będzie informacji o danej właściwości węzła lub relacji zostaw pole puste.

Nie upraszczaj grafu. Docelowa ilość węzłów ma być taka jak w tekście. 

Dodatkowo dodaj poza podstawowymi właściwościami które sa podane w strukturze dodatkowe właściwości:
-Dla nodes i edges:
"label" -> w niej ma być jaki to typ węzła lub relacji. (JUNCTION, TANK, PIPE ...)
-Dla nodes:
"Id" -> unikalne id (identity), czyli zaczynająca sie od 1 inkrementująca wartość.
Dla edges:
"from" oraz "to" -> id węzłów uczesticzących w relacji.

Wygenerowaną reprezentacje grafową przedstaw jako plik json.
Ma on mieć dwa pola: nodes oraz edges.
Pola te są tablicami i masz tam zapisywać wygenerowane węzły lub relacje.

Generuj jedynie czysty plik json, bez żadnych komentarzy albo markdown.

***Struktura grafu***

1. Nodes:

	
	JUNCTION - points in the network where links (PIPE, PUMP, VALVE) join together and where water enters or leaves the network 
	RESERVOIR - used to model such things as lakes, rivers, groundwater aquifers. Represent an infinite external source or sink of water.

2. Edges:
	
	PIPE - convey water from one point in the network to another.

3. Properties
	
	-JUNCTION:
		Elev - Elevation, ft (m)
		Demand - Base demand flow (flow units) (optional)
	
	-RESERVOIR:
		Head - Head, ft (m)
		
			
	-PIPE:
		Length - Length, ft (m)
		Diameter - Diameter, inches (mm)
		Roughness - Roughness coefficient
		MinorLoss - Minor loss coefficient
		Status - Status (OPEN, CLOSED, or CV)
		

***Koniec struktury grafu***


***Tekst***

The network is supplied by two reservoirs, designated as ID 11 and ID 10, to distinguish them from the junction identifiers.

Reservoir 11 has a Total Head of 1000 and connects via a pipe to Junction 1. From Junction 1, the pipeline continues sequentially through Junctions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,8 ending at Junction 9.

Reservoir 10, with a Total Head of 500, is connected directly to Junction 9.

The network includes two additional pipe connections (loops):

Between Junction 2 and Junction 9.

Between Junction 4 and Junction 8.

Base Demands are assigned as follows:

Junction 1: 100

Junction 3: 300

Junction 6: 600
***Koniec Tekst***

{
  "nodes": [
    {"Id": 1, "label": "RESERVOIR", "Head": 1000, "Elev": null, "Demand": null},
    {"Id": 2, "label": "JUNCTION", "Head": null, "Elev": null, "Demand": 100},
    {"Id": 3, "label": "JUNCTION", "Head": null, "Elev": null, "Demand": null},
    {"Id": 4, "label": "JUNCTION", "Head": null, "Elev": null, "Demand": 300},
    {"Id": 5, "label": "JUNCTION", "Head": null, "Elev": null, "Demand": null},
    {"Id": 6, "label": "JUNCTION", "Head": null, "Elev": null, "Demand": null},
    {"Id": 7, "label": "JUNCTION", "Head": null, "Elev": null, "Demand": 600},
    {"Id": 8, "label": "JUNCTION", "Head": null, "Elev": null, "Demand": null},
    {"Id": 9, "label": "JUNCTION", "Head": null, "Elev": null, "Demand": null},
    {"Id": 10, "label": "JUNCTION", "Head": null, "Elev": null, "Demand": null},
    {"Id": 11, "label": "RESERVOIR", "Head": 500, "Elev": null, "Demand": null}
  ],
  "edges": [
    {"from": 1, "to": 2, "label": "PIPE", "Length": null, "Diameter": null, "Roughness": null, "MinorLoss": null, "Status": null},
    {"from": 2, "to": 3, "label": "PIPE", "Length": null, "Diameter": null, "Roughness": null, "MinorLoss": null, "Status": null},
    {"from": 3, "to": 4, "label": "PIPE", "Length": null, "Diameter": null, "Roughness": null, "MinorLoss": null, "Status": null},
    {"from": 4, "to": 5, "label": "PIPE", "Length": null, "Diameter": null, "Roughness": null, "MinorLoss": null, "Status": null},
    {"from": 5, "to": 6, "label": "PIPE", "Length": null, "Diameter": null, "Roughness": null, "MinorLoss": null, "Status": null},
    {"from": 6, "to": 7, "label": "PIPE", "Length": null, "Diameter": null, "Roughness": null, "MinorLoss": null, "Status": null},
    {"from": 7, "to": 8, "label": "PIPE", "Length": null, "Diameter": null, "Roughness": null, "MinorLoss": null, "Status": null},
    {"from": 8, "to": 9, "label": "PIPE", "Length": null, "Diameter": null, "Roughness": null, "MinorLoss": null, "Status": null},
    {"from": 9, "to": 10, "label": "PIPE", "Length": null, "Diameter": null, "Roughness": null, "MinorLoss": null, "Status": null},
    {"from": 11, "to": 10, "label": "PIPE", "Length": null, "Diameter": null, "Roughness": null, "MinorLoss": null, "Status": null},
    {"from": 3, "to": 10, "label": "PIPE", "Length": null, "Diameter": null, "Roughness": null, "MinorLoss": null, "Status": null},
    {"from": 5, "to": 9, "label": "PIPE", "Length": null, "Diameter": null, "Roughness": null, "MinorLoss": null, "Status": null}
  ]
}
